result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Matthew Whitledge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason Matthew Whitledge is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason Matthew Whitledge was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED/STAYED.
Consecutive to 15CF574 and 15CM323.
Consecutive to:

***AMENDED***
Per Judge Eric J. Lundell March 30, 2016 - amend to 2 years probation.

Concurrent.
Court dismisses Counts 2 - 4.
Defendant to report to Probation March 17, 2016.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Julie A. Weber, DF: Jason Mathew Whitledge appeared from jail.  Court called at 2:51 p.m.  There is an agreement.  ADA Minser recites the agreement.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 in 15CF410 to misdemenaor theft 943.20(1)(a) and DE will plead to Ct. 1 in 15CF574 & Ct. 1 in 15CM323.  Victim's rights have been complied with while coming to this resolution.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver or Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to the amended Ct 1 in 15CF410 (Misdemeanor Theft).  DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 1 in 15CF574.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct. 1 in 15CM323.  Court reviews the police report and testimony at the preliminary hearing on August 31, 2015.   Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 1 in 15CF410, Ct. 1 in 15CM323 & Ct. 1  15CF574. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2, Ct 3 & Ct 4 in 15CF410 & Ct. 2 & Ct. 3 in 15CF574. Victim makes statement.  Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement.  Crt orders:

IMPOSED AND STAYED
15CF574 Ct. 1
3 Years Initial confinement and 3 years probation
- DE placed on probation for 3 years withheld and to run concurrent to 15CM323 & 15CF410
- 135 days conditional jail time credit for 90 days served
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- DE to go through MRT within a year
- Contact with victim and family to be determined by the probation agent
-- Court costs of$268.00 and $250.00 for the DNA Surcharge

IMPOSED AND STAYED
15CM323 Ct. 1 
- DE sentenced to 90 days in the St. Croix County Jail that runs consecutive to jail in 15CF574 & 15CF410
- DE placed on probation for 3 years withheld and to run concurrent to 15CF574 & 15CF410
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
 - AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- DE to go through MRT within a year
- Contact with victim and family to be determined by the probation agent
- Court costs of $243.00 and $200.00 for the DNA Surcharge

IMPOSED AND STAYED
15CF410 Ct. 1
- DE sentenced to 9 months in the St. Croix County Jail  that runs consecutive to jail in 15CF574 & 15CM323
- DE placed on probation for 3 years withheld and to run concurrent to 15CF574 & 15CM323
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
 - AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- DE to go through MRT within a year
- Contact with victim and family to be determined by the probation agent
- Court cost of $243.00 and $200.00 for the DNA Surcharge

- DE to sign up for probation on 03/17/16
- 20 days to appeal
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-04-2016 02:30 pm

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Julie A. Weber, DF: Jason Mathew Whitledge appeared from jail.  Court called at 1:09 p.m. Includes case 15CF410, 15CM323 & 15CF574 (Arraignment).  Court proceeds with the arraignment in 15CF574.  Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads not guilty.  Not guilty plea is entered.  Attorney Weber advises she is still working on getting the DE into a treatment facility.  Set out for STC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 1:13 p.m. lw  Status conference scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Matthew L. Hartung, DF ATTY:  Julie A. Weber   DF:  Jason Mathew Whitledge appeared from jail.  Court called at 11:30 a.m.  Includes case 15CF410, 15CF574 (Preliminary Hearing) & 15CM323.  DE files with the court the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver for 15CF574.  Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Attorney Weber advises she has been in contact with the DE's Rule 25 coordinator.  There should be a bed available for the DE within the week.  Attorney Weber will schedule a bail bond hearing once the DE can be admitted into a treatment facility.  Set out for arraignment on 15CF574.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 11:37 a.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Rohan, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, NONA by def. Includes 15CF410 and 15CM323. Was time set for Status Conference. Atty. CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb,ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Julie A. Weber, DF: Jason Matthew Whitledge did not appear.  Court called at 3:47 p.m.  Includes case 15CM323 & 15CF410.  Set for BBH and DE has not gotten notice of this hearing.  Co-signer has requested a bail bond hearing due to the DEs behavior.  Co-signer makes statement.  State is asking for a bench warrant.  Court authorizes a warrant - stayed until 11/19/15 @ 1:00 p.m..  Court strikes the co-signature bond and the $25,000 cash bond is back in place.  Court adjourned at 3:57 p.m. lw  Status conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 10-08-2015 11:00 am

*AMENDED*

Co-Signed by mother, SURETY NAME: Janet Hammer
- DE to reside with mother at 5820 Scandia Trail N, Forest Lake, MN 55025
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- DE will not come back to Wisconsin with the exception of court hearings.
-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Ericka S. or B.A.S. dob 3/16/03.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Matthew L Hartung, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Jason Mathew Whitledge appeared.  Court called at 2:35 p.m.  Includes case 15CF410 (Preliminary Hearing) & 15CM323 (STC).  Court proceeds with preliminary hearing on 15CF410.  S/T of Chief of Police Mark Richert of the Village of North Hudson.  Direct by ADA Hartung.  DE is identified by Police Chief Richert.  Cross by Attorney Kucinski.   Re-direct by ADA Hartung.   Witness excused.  State files the Information with the court.  Attorneys argue bond.  Bail is continued.  Set out for arraignment.  Court adjourned at 2:50 p.m.   lw  Arraignment scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing at 08-31-2015 01:00 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Ericka S. or B.A.S. dob 3/16/03.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
